description.b: This cheat sheet will show you how to create a VTK pipeline file.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse User perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse User perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Other... and select g-Eclipse (User). Alternatively, click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Select the Grid Project View
item.description: Select the Grid Project View on your g-Eclipse Workbench.

item.title: Launch the VTK Pipeline Wizard
item.description: Right-click into that view and select New > Other.. > VTK Pipeline to launch the wizard.

item.title: Name your VTK Pipeline File
item.description: Make sure you have selected the directory where the VTK Pipeline will be stored, name your file or accept the default and click Next.

item.title: Define the VTK Pipeline
item.description: Enter the main content of the file. Note that the current implementation is not dependent on the type of data and type of output. Choose any.

subitem.label: Type of Data: Select one of the available types of data.

Data Source Location: Use the browse button to select the location of your data source. Note that current implementation can only visualise data that is locally present on your machine. If your data is located remotely, please copy it over to your machine first.
Output Type: Select one of the available output types.

item.title: Complete the VTK Pipeline File Creation
item.description: Click Finish to complete the VTK Pipeline creation.
